main.name: Pareesh Madan
main.description: Hard-Working Software Engineer and Computer Science Student at the University of Guelph
main.bio: I have always been fascinated with the boundless and infinite capabilities of computers which motivated me to pursue a future in Computer Science. Currently pursing internship oppurtunities for Summer 2026.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to email me at madanp@uoguelph.ca or call me at 519-362-1324

education.degree: Bachelor of Computer Science, Business Data Analytics Minor (Co-op)
education.description: Relevant Courses: OOP, Data Structures, Software System Development & Integration, Operating Systems, Theory of Computation

work.title: Software Developer Co-op
work.description: Designing and developing Windows desktop software for automated lab instrumentation using C# and .NET.

work.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant
work.description: Built an interactive assessment tool using JavaScript, enabling researchers to analyze social isolation metrics.

work.title: Software Engineer Co-op
work.description: Developed and maintained functional test cases for middleware and infrastructure tools, improving qualityassurance coverage and strengthening critical thinking by identifying edge cases and potential failures.
work.description2: Collaborated with cross-functional teams by participating in peer reviews, team stand-ups, and incident documentation, enhancing communication skills and contributing ideas to improve automation practices and internal workflows.

work.title: Software Developer Intern
work.description: Developed a prototype neural network using TensorFlow for image classification to detect diseases in cow lymph nodes, trained on a dataset of over 3,500 annotated DICOM-formatted X-ray images.
work.description2: Designed and implemented a Python-based image format converter program, streamlining the preprocessing of DICOM images for training the neural network.
